item.title: Set up for C++/C Development in Neovim
item.description: This post summarizes how to set up various plugins needed for C++/C code editing, linting and formatting.

item.title: Commonly-used Building Options Explained
item.description: On Linux system, if we do not have root priviledge, we can not use package managers to install a package to its default location (usually under /usr). Besides, the packages installed by the package managers are often too old to have the latest features. Or, even if we have root priviledge, we do not want to mess up with the system-wide packages and just want to experiment with a package locally. On these ocassions, we may want to install the package to a custom location.
